alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Lewis and Clark (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 4:28PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Lewis and Clark County through 500 PM MDT... At 428 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles northeast of Garrison, or 22 miles north of Deer Lodge, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Lewis and Clark County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central and Southern Lewis and Clark
